classifications.evidence: Multiple OCR errors: 'TWE NTIETH' (should be 'TWENTIETH'), 'qermany' (should be 'Germany'), 'eeonomic' (should be 'economic'), 'twe' (fragment). However, context is clear and semantic meaning preserved for embedding purposes.
Roman numerals (xxxiii, xxi, xlviii, etc.) are properly OCR'd. 'etc' is correct abbreviation. All words are recognizable and maintain semantic clarity for RAG embedding.
Proper names (plekhanov, kautsky, pannekoek, communards) are correctly OCR'd. 'programme' is valid British spelling. Clean text suitable for embedding.
Minor fragmentation: 'conjuga' at line break is part of 'conjugations' continued on next line. All substantive words are correct (Getzler, Martov, Rabinowitch). Text integrity maintained.

Errors include: 'honour' (British spelling, correct), 'kilometre' (correct), 'ilich' (proper name, correct), 'grigori' (proper name, correct), 'fugi' (fragment - should be 'fugitives'). The 'fugi' error slightly damages meaning but context is recoverable.

Fragmented words typical of page breaks: 'disrup' (disruption), 'casti' (castigated), 'tage' (damage/advantage), 'tation' (demonstration). These are hyphenation artifacts, not true OCR errors. All meaning recoverable from context.

Line-break fragments: 'manifes' (manifestations), 'corre' (corresponded), 'ariat' (proletariat), 'tation' (presentation), 'prolet' (proletarian), 'empha' (emphasized), 'exploi' (exploitation), 'tations' (manifestations), 'sponded' (corresponded). These are word-wrap artifacts at end of lines, not semantic errors.

Hyphenated word fragments: 'tion' (multiple occurrences), 'partici' (participated), 'tionary' (revolutionary), 'nism' (communism), 'commu' (communism), 'vulgariza' (vulgarization), 'revolu' (revolution), 'pannekoek' (proper name, correct). These are formatting artifacts from hyphenation across lines.
Proper handling of contractions and sophisticated vocabulary: 'accesssible', 'February' (correct), 'communica' is fragment of 'communication'. Overall text quality excellent with minimal true errors.

Errors: 'mtelligentki' (should be 'intelligentki' or 'intelligentsia'), 'inaccu' (fragment, part of 'inaccuracy'). Word 'overbrimmed' is valid but unusual. The 'mtelligentki' error is OCR corruption of a foreign word transliteration.
High-quality text with only minor fragments: 'parlia' (parliament), 'ments' (governments). All substantive content is clear. Text is suitable for embedding with minimal interpretation needed.

Solid OCR with proper handling of technical and historical terms: 'argumenta' is fragment of 'argumentation', proper names correctly rendered (Menshevik, Kautsky, Martov, Yuli). Semantic content intact.
Proper names and technical terms well-OCR'd: 'auguste', 'blanqui', 'rigour', 'minoritarian', 'sented' (presented). Hyphenation artifacts are minimal and don't damage meaning.
Historical names and terms correctly rendered: 'potch' (hotch-potch variant), 'libertar' (libertarian fragment), 'reichstags', 'mensheviks'. Text quality high despite complex political terminology.
Strong OCR quality: 'propertyless', 'specializa' (fragment of specialization), 'niques' (techniques), 'ment' (fragment). Complex philosophical and economic concepts are properly captured.
Proper names and technical terms well-handled: 'Zinoviev', 'Michels', 'bureaucratiza' (bureaucratization fragment), 'gence' (emergence). Overall text maintains semantic integrity for embedding.
Good OCR with proper handling of French phrases ('etat') and historical names. Minor fragments: 'immedi' (immediately), 'advan' (advantage), 'garded' (regarded). Context is clear throughout.
Sophisticated text well-OCR'd: 'misanticipated', 'litovsk', 'unpub' (unpublished), 'elec' (election). Proper nouns and specialized historical terms are accurate. No semantic corruption.
Complex political and historical vocabulary handled well: 'crudified', 'terpretation' (interpretation), 'dictions' (contradictions). Text is semantically sound for RAG embedding.
Proper names and specialized terms correct: 'Bogdanov', 'Kautsky', 'Gramsci', 'Fyodor'. Minor fragment: 'succour' is correct British spelling. Overall high quality.
Excellent OCR of complex content: 'liberational', 'honour' (British spelling), 'hegemony' implied. All major concepts are clearly rendered for semantic understanding.
Sophisticated vocabulary well-captured: 'unmistakable', 'sceptical', 'stalinization', 'perestroika'. Minor fragments: 'poli' (policy), 'inspira' (inspiration). Semantic content intact.
High-quality OCR with only minor hyphenation artifacts: 'subse' (subsequently), 'constitu' (constitutional). All substantive meaning is preserved. Suitable for RAG embedding.

Severe OCR corruption of Cyrillic text with 71% error rate. Gibberish: 'mecm', 'pebo', 'detporpaak', 'tejiefora', 'bbinycxi', 'mjibhht', 'xhhronsaatbjbctbo'. This is a facsimile of Russian title page - OCR completely failed on Cyrillic script. Would severely damage embeddings.
classifications.review_note: Reclassified from BAD: foreign language terms incorrectly flagged

classifications.evidence: Preface text with proper names and complex political terminology handled well: 'Hyndman', 'Potresov', 'Tsereteli', 'Chernov', 'Renaudel', 'Guesde'. Minor artifact: 'labouring' (British spelling, correct). Text integrity maintained.
